channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: North Korea fires cruise missile salvo as Kim Jong-un ramps up rhetoric
item.description: Multiple projectiles were detected around the waters near North Korea’s Sinpo area, as Seoul steps up monitoring Pyongyang’s movements.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: X to open new Texas office to combat child porn
item.description: The company aims to recruit content moderators focused on weeding out child sexual exploitation content and other violations of the platform’s rules.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Federal Reserve’s decision this week could be the prelude to a March interest rate cut
item.description: Any signal Fed’s Chair Jerome Powell may choose to send is of critical importance. It all comes down to how Powell and his colleagues have been reading the recent spate of economic data.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Covid-19 deaths drag down Hong Kong life expectancy, but population experts say no cause for alarm
item.description: Hong Kong loses top spot for longevity to Japan in 2022, but experts expect it to climb back up again.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Cheung
item.author: Elizabeth Cheung

item.title: Cathay Pacific flight heading to Penang forced to return to Hong Kong over ‘unusual smell’ in plane cabin
item.description: Flight CX 633 was scheduled to arrive in Penang at 12.05pm.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Chow
item.author: Fiona Chow

item.title: India’s publishing world has ‘hardly any diversity’. Dalit writers are changing that
item.description: For decades, writers from India’s ‘lowest’ caste say their voices have been muted. Independent publishers are seeking a new chapter in representation.
item.dc:creator: Asma Hafiz
item.author: Asma Hafiz

item.title: India pivots away from Russian arms, but will retain strong ties
item.description: A major military deal with Russia ‘would be a red line for Washington’, one analyst notes, as India boosts ties with the US amid concerns over Moscow’s ability to supply munitions.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Trump test could prove toughest challenge for Taiwan’s next president William Lai
item.description: If he defeats Joe Biden, the former US president’s unpredictability and America-first approach could prove a major headache for the incoming Taiwanese leader.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: Royal Caribbean’s ‘Icon of the Seas’, world’s largest cruise ship, sets sail
item.description: The ship has 20 decks, seven swimming pools, more than 40 dining venues and bars, and room for more than 5,600 passengers.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Will new rail link push more Singaporeans to opt for life in Johor Bahru as cost of living, rent in city state soars?
item.description: Despite a strong Singapore dollar and weak Malaysian ringgit, Singaporeans are not eyeing large properties in JB and are prioritising connectivity instead.
item.dc:creator: Hadi Azmi
item.author: Hadi Azmi

item.title: ‘My food is covered in pee’: China customer accuses delivery man of urinating on her meal, surveillance footage shows dog is culprit
item.description: A customer of a food delivery firm in China was horrified to find her order was covered in pee when she opened the door to pick it up, but it was not the driver who did it, as she suspected.
item.dc:creator: Liya Su
item.author: Liya Su

item.title: ‘No one to help’: Sri Lankan migrant workers in Hong Kong lack support, face exploitation and abuse, NGOs say
item.description: Sri Lankan women make up less than 1 per cent of foreign domestic workers and don’t have strong networks, in contrast with some other groups of helpers.
item.dc:creator: Connor Mycroft
item.author: Connor Mycroft

item.title: Israel’s Netanyahu defiant after UN court ruling as deaths in Gaza offensive continue
item.description: The ICJ ruling stopped short of ordering a ceasefire, but was in part a rebuke of Israel’s conduct in its nearly four-month war against Hamas.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Did Chinese explorers land on Australia’s shores almost 200 years before Europeans?
item.description: Research of a historical map suggests Chinese mariners travelled to Australia and New Zealand in the 1400s.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bela
item.author: Victoria Bela

item.title: Where are the bodies? Ukraine presses Russia for proof of POW deaths
item.description: Kyiv has not outright denied Moscow’s claims that it shot down a military plane, but it has raised questions about whether the prisoners were actually on board.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: UK Post Office scandal: chairman Henry Staunton to step down amid mounting public anger
item.description: Hundreds of postal staff were wrongfully convicted of theft and fraud as a result of glitches in Fujitsu’s Horizon software.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 2 Hong Kong electricity outages in Tsing Yi in space of week caused by degradation of parts, CLP Power says
item.description: CLP has submitted two reports to the Electrical and Mechanical Services Department over the past week over the incidents, firm says.
item.dc:creator: Jess Ma
item.author: Jess Ma

item.title: Israel vows to stop UNRWA’s activities in Gaza after war following sacking of staff
item.description: Australia, Canada, Italy and Britain have followed the lead of the US, which said it suspended additional cash to the UN agency for Palestinian refugees after Tel Aviv’s accusations that employees were involved in the October 7 attack.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Philippine troops kill 9 suspected Muslim militants, including 2 accused of Mass bombing
item.description: Army forces clashed with about 15 militants in a series of shoot-outs, with the dead including suspects in the December 3 bombing that killed four Catholic worshippers and wounded dozens.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: China and US ‘step in the right direction’ with top-level talks in Thailand
item.description: US national security adviser Jake Sullivan and Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi tackle Taiwan and the Middle East in discussions in Bangkok, and pave the way for a call between Xi Jinping and Joe Biden in ‘coming months’.
item.dc:creator: Shi Jiangtao,Khushboo Razdan
item.author: Shi Jiangtao,Khushboo Razdan

item.title: Hong Kong Observatory issues cold weather warning, further dip in temperatures expected overnight
item.description: Minimum temperature in urban areas forecast to hover around 12 degrees Celsius overnight and a couple of degrees lower in the New Territories.
item.dc:creator: Jess Ma
item.author: Jess Ma

item.title: ‘Patriarchy kills’: hundreds march in Kenya against the murder of women
item.description: At least 16 women have been killed this month. The government says 30 per cent of women experience physical violence and 13 per cent experience sexual violence.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: As Philippines plans to upgrade South China Sea outposts, Beijing weighs options
item.description: China appears to be taking ‘wait and see’ approach after Manila says it will improve facilities for troops deployed on disputed reefs and islands.
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Chen
item.author: Alyssa Chen

item.title: Hong Kong police make biggest Ecstasy seizure in 20 years, intercept drugs worth HK$5.2 million and arrest 3 in Sai Kung
item.description: Police say they discovered 33.3kg of illegal drugs in house in Kau Sai San Tsuen, including 46,000 Ecstasy pills.
item.dc:creator: Jess Ma
item.author: Jess Ma

item.title: Hong Kong on track to restore passenger traffic to pre-pandemic levels by end of year, senior Airport Authority official says
item.description: “We have confidence that passenger traffic will return to 100 per cent by the end of this year, or close to 100 per cent,” executive director Steven Yiu says.
item.dc:creator: Laura Westbrook
item.author: Laura Westbrook

item.title: China father becomes lawyer to get justice for son, 11, who leapt to his death after being verbally abused by teacher
item.description: The father of a young boy in China, who took his own life at the age of 11 after being verbally abused by a teacher at school, gave up his job as a traffic policeman to become a lawyer so he could fight his dead son’s case in court.
item.dc:creator: Fran Lu
item.author: Fran Lu

item.title: Over 17,000 hectares in Colombia destroyed by forest fires in hottest January for decades
item.description: More than 340 forest blazes - including near the capital Bogota - have been recorded in recent weeks, spurred by drought, with residents near burnt areas advised to avoid going outside due to poor air quality.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Babysitter, 33, arrested in Hong Kong for suspected child abuse after 9-month-old girl falls into coma with blood clot on brain
item.description: Hospital Authority says the baby is in a critical condition.
item.dc:creator: Cannix Yau
item.author: Cannix Yau

item.title: Hong Kong customs seizes suspected smuggled goods worth HK$4 million, including frozen venison tails and aquarium animals
item.description: Officers find 24 boxes of frozen venison tails, 14 containing aquarium animals and 10 bags of suspected scheduled dried shark fins.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: China’s clean energy boom ‘an example to the entire world’, IEA analyst says
item.description: Renewable capacity is expanding at an unprecedented pace, with China’s solar PV installations last year equal to the world’s total in 2022, according to report.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bela
item.author: Victoria Bela

item.title: Chinese villages offer cash rewards to matchmakers as anxieties grow over rural ‘bachelor crisis’
item.description: Local governments across China announce incentives of up to US$140 for those who help unmarried men find wives as some policymakers worry gender imbalance and surplus of single men could affect stability and development in countryside.
item.dc:creator: He Huifeng
item.author: He Huifeng

item.title: Hongkongers flock to see ‘magnificent’ cherry blossoms, as pink winter wonderland at airport opens for the season
item.description: Garden on the outskirts of Hong Kong International Airport is home to 85 freshly planted cherry blossoms, opening to public for its second year.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Heung
item.author: Sammy Heung

item.title: Amid Red Sea clashes, India and Asean must work to secure the Indian Ocean
item.description: Indian Ocean stability and security are vital for Southeast Asia, to defend against pirates and secure oil cargo and trade. Amid US-China rivalry, India is Asean’s natural security partner.
item.dc:creator: Shristi Pukhrem,Don McLain Gill
item.author: Shristi Pukhrem,Don McLain Gill

item.title: Hong Kong’s environment chief admits government has not done enough to explain delayed waste-charging plan
item.description: Secretary for Environment and Ecology Tse Chin-wan pledges to arrange 660-litre mobile bins near some old buildings to ease residents into scheme.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Ahead of key elections, India’s opposition struggles to play catch-up amid low visibility, poor messaging
item.description: Congress has struggled to gain voter attention in the past decade, with party renewal hampered by the old guard and a lack of clear policy goals among issues.
item.dc:creator: Biman Mukherji
item.author: Biman Mukherji

item.title: Is Beijing planning further diplomatic isolation for Taiwan in wake of William Lai’s win?
item.description: Following Nauru’s diplomatic switch, mainland China is expected to further restrict the island’s international space.
item.dc:creator: Kawala Xie
item.author: Kawala Xie

item.title: Hong Kong schools hit by falling enrolments hope to woo more mainland Chinese students at second education exposition
item.description: Organiser hopes to include more kindergartens, in addition to showcasing primary and secondary schools.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Russian man faces 5 years in jail for flying on Denmark-Los Angeles plane without passport or ticket
item.description: A jury found Sergey Vladimirovich Ochigava guilty of one count of being a stowaway on an aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Hongkongers should get Covid XBB variant jabs, flu shots ahead of Lunar New Year amid higher outbreak risk, medical expert says
item.description: Professor Ivan Hung says about 80 per cent of cases at Queen Mary Hospital’s isolation ward are related to Covid-19.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: Malaysian anti-corruption agency asks another Mahathir son to declare assets as probe expands
item.description: Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission sends asset declaration notice to businessman Mokhzani Mahathir.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Russian fishing ships seen off Fukushima reflects Moscow’s ‘hypocrisy’ over Japanese seafood ban
item.description: The presence of the three ships close to Japan’s coast is Moscow’s “signal” to Tokyo to withdraw support for sanctions against Russia, analysts say.
item.dc:creator: Julian Ryall
item.author: Julian Ryall

item.title: Woman spends night in China hotel with man she met online, shares bed to ‘test’ his powers of restraint, claims rape
item.description: A young woman in China says she was raped by a man she met online after she agreed to sleep in the same bed as him for a night without having sex, as a way of “testing” his powers of restraint.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Hong Kong police file 2 extra charges against student also facing accusations related to alleged sexual misconduct during university orientation events
item.description: Fourth-year student was earlier charged with three counts of indecent assault and voyeurism in relation to allegations of sexual misconduct during university orientation events.
item.dc:creator: Kahon Chan
item.author: Kahon Chan

item.title: 47 Hong Kong teachers deregistered in 2023 over professional misconduct, such as theft-related crimes and child abuse, more than double figure for 2022
item.description: Authorities took action against 171 teachers last year over professional misconduct, up from 104 in 2022 and 151 in 2021.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: Fan sues 50 Cent, alleging rapper threw microphone at her face during Los Angeles concert
item.description: The lawsuit said the device hit radio host Bryhana Monegain’s face and left wrist, resulting in ‘severe and permanent’ injuries.
item.dc:creator: Tribune News Service
item.author: Tribune News Service

item.title: US visit firms speculation Liu Jianchao will be China’s next foreign minister
item.description: 6-day trip by the veteran party diplomat to coincide with the Taiwan election was a ‘smart move’ by Beijing, observers say.
item.dc:creator: Shi Jiangtao
item.author: Shi Jiangtao

item.title: Hong Kong cold spell threatens Lunar New Year blooms, giving flower farmers the jitters
item.description: Braced for the worst, some farmers say cold weather may result in lower yields.
item.dc:creator: Meredith Chen
item.author: Meredith Chen

item.title: Singapore jeweller’s crowning moment: designing Brunei Princess Anisha Rosnah’s tiara worn at her wedding
item.description: The tiara made of 18-carat gold and 838 diamonds first made its appearance at Princess Azemah Bolkiah’s wedding last year.
item.dc:creator: Kimberly Lim
item.author: Kimberly Lim

item.title: China, Malaysia nearing new durian deal, and an extension of visa-free travel is on the table
item.description: ‘Complex’ negotiations have come down to ironing out the finer points of a deal that would bring fresh Malaysian durians into the world’s biggest market for the ‘king of fruits’, consul general says.
item.dc:creator: Ralph Jennings
item.author: Ralph Jennings

item.title: Tech war: US wants cloud firms to report foreign users tapping their computing power for AI applications
item.description: The Biden administration wants such disclosures in an effort to detect foreign actors that might use artificial intelligence to launch ‘malicious cyber-enabled activity’.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg
